definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose

sentences.english: Well, shouldn't you try to stop them from making this big mistake?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，那你该不该试着阻止他们闯下大祸？

sentences.english: I have been exposed to the presentiment of catastrophe for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 几星期来我一直有大祸临头的感觉。

sentences.english: They must have thought they were going to get in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 她们立马四散而逃，她们肯定以为自己闯了什么大祸。

sentences.english: For me, the july twentieth affair was in every way a calamity .
sentences.chinese: 就我来说，七月二十日事件完全是大祸临头。

sentences.english: Small radioactive source results in big accident" have occurred repeatedly in China and worldwide alike."
sentences.chinese: “小源闯大祸”已经在国内外发生多次。

sentences.english: Selfishness is the greatest curse of the human race.
sentences.chinese: 怎么是人类的最大祸源。

sentences.english: During the past the week, I almost always feeling having disaster strikes.
sentences.chinese: 几星期来我一直有大祸临头的感觉。

sentences.english: A rise in interest rates would be disastrous for millions.
sentences.chinese: 利率的增长对数百万人来说是大祸临头。

sentences.english: "Without collective awakening the catastrophe will come, " he warns.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有集体的觉醒，大祸即将临头。

sentences.english: This same thing, happening in wartime, would lead to a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 同样白勺事，如发生在战时，就会酿成大祸。

sentences.english: Even small mistakes can have devastating consequences.
sentences.chinese: 即使是小错也可能酿成大祸。

sentences.english: PROMPT】His prompt action prevented serious trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速的行动避免了大祸。

sentences.english: Damn boys don't think about the wrath that's about to set down on them.
sentences.chinese: 混小子，也不想想，他们就快要大祸临头了。

sentences.english: Oh, calamity , is there no way out?
sentences.chinese: 噢大祸临头了这下可有生路？

sentences.english: "This is a catastrophe for Iran's cinema, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “这对伊朗的电影业来说是大祸临头，”他说。

sentences.english: Today his usually gib tongue has brought him catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 往日的一张利嘴今天却给他惹了大祸。

definition: to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
